data.enText: betting
bet
bet
to risk money on a race or an event by trying to predict the result

data.chText: 赌博者年龄不得低于16岁。
data.enText: You have to be over 16 to bet.

data.chText: 他下2 000元赌比赛的最后比分。
data.enText: He bet $2 000 on the final score of the game.

data.chText: 她和我打20英镑的赌，说我不会那么做。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: She bet me £20 that I wouldn't do it.
used to say that you are almost certain that sth is true or that sth will happen
I bet (that) we're too late.

data.chText: 几乎可以肯定，我一坐下，电话铃就会响起来。
data.enText: You can bet (that) the moment I sit down, the phone will ring.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: I'll bet you (that) he knows all about it.
I/I'll bet!
used to show that you can understand what sb is feeling, describing, etc.

data.chText: “他告诉我时，我差一点死掉了。”“肯定是这样！”
data.enText: ‘I nearly died when he told me.’ ‘I bet!’
used to tell sb that you do not believe what they have just said

data.chText: “我要告诉她我对她的看法。”“量你不敢！”
data.enText: ‘I'm going to tell her what I think of her.’ ‘Yeah, I bet!’
I wouldn't bet on it
don't bet on it
used to say that you do not think that sth is very likely

data.chText: “她很快就会接受这种看法的。”“很难说。”
data.enText: ‘She'll soon get used to the idea.’ ‘I wouldn't bet on it.’
you bet!
used instead of ‘yes’ to emphasize that sb has guessed sth correctly or made a good suggestion
‘Are you nervous?’ ‘You bet!’
you can bet your life/your bottom dollar (on sth/(that)…)
used to say that you are certain that sth will happen
You can bet your bottom dollar that he'll be late.
an arrangement to risk money, etc. on the result of a particular event; the money that you risk in this way
to win/lose a bet

data.chText: 我们打了个赌，看谁先到。
data.enText: We've got a bet on who's going to arrive first.

data.chText: 他在那些马上下了赌注。
data.enText: He had a bet on the horses.
‘Liverpool are bound to win.’ ‘Do you want a bet?’ (= I disagree with you, I don't think they will.)

data.chText: 他们都对比赛下了赌注。
data.enText: They all put a bet on the race.

data.chText: 我听说你愿意拿她是否会嫁给他的事和人打赌。
data.enText: I hear you're taking bets on whether she'll marry him.

data.chText: 我是为了打赌才这么干的。
data.enText: I did it for a bet (= because sb had agreed to pay me money if I did) .
an opinion about what is likely to happen or to have happened
My bet is that they've been held up in traffic.
the/your best bet
used to tell sb what is the best action for them to take to get the result they want

data.chText: 如果你想在伦敦快速出行，最好是乘地铁。
data.enText: If you want to get around London fast, the Underground is your best bet.
a good/safe bet

data.chText: 很可能发生的事；有望成功的事；合适的东西
data.enText: something that is likely to happen, to succeed or to be suitable

data.chText: 衣服适合作为送给十几岁孩子的礼物。
data.enText: Clothes are a safe bet as a present for a teenager.
hedge your bets

data.chText: （为防止损失或出错）几面下注，有几项选择可选取
data.enText: to reduce the risk of losing or making a mistake by supporting more than one side in a competition, an argument, etc., or by having several choices available to you

ex.chText: 我们在那匹马上下了很大的赌注。
ex.enText: We gambled heavily on that horse.

synonyms.bx: 指为获得钱物而在纸牌、赛马等中投机冒险。

ex.chText: 我同你打赌5美元英国队会赢得世界杯。
ex.enText: I bet you 5 dollars that the British team will win the World Cup.

ex.chText: 他在那匹白马上下了50美元的赌注。
ex.enText: He bet $50 on the white horse.
I bet that he wouldn't come.

synonyms.bx: 多指对比赛等打赌，也指双方对有疑惑、争执之事打赌。

ex.chText: 我将把我的名誉赌在这个结果上。
ex.enText: I will stake my good reputation on the outcome.

ex.chText: 他把所有的钱都押在这桩有风险的生意上。
ex.enText: He staked all his money on the risky business.

synonyms.bx: 指用贵重或重要之物当赌注，如名誉、财产等，通常与介词 on 连用。

data.enText: I/I'll bet!
used to show that you can understand what sb is feeling, describing, etc.

data.chText: “他告诉我时，我差一点死掉了。”“肯定是这样！”
data.enText: ‘I nearly died when he told me.’ ‘I bet!’
used to tell sb that you do not believe what they have just said

data.chText: “我要告诉她我对她的看法。”“量你不敢！”
data.enText: ‘I'm going to tell her what I think of her.’ ‘Yeah, I bet!’
I wouldn't bet on it
don't bet on it
used to say that you do not think that sth is very likely

data.chText: “她很快就会接受这种看法的。”“很难说。”
data.enText: ‘She'll soon get used to the idea.’ ‘I wouldn't bet on it.’

used instead of ‘yes’ to emphasize that sb has guessed sth correctly or made a good suggestion
‘Are you nervous?’ ‘You bet!’

You can bet your bottom dollar that he'll be late.

used to tell sb what is the best action for them to take to get the result they want

data.chText: 如果你想在伦敦快速出行，最好是乘地铁。
data.enText: If you want to get around London fast, the Underground is your best bet.
a good/safe bet

data.chText: 很可能发生的事；有望成功的事；合适的东西
data.enText: something that is likely to happen, to succeed or to be suitable

data.chText: 衣服适合作为送给十几岁孩子的礼物。
data.enText: Clothes are a safe bet as a present for a teenager.

data.chText: （为防止损失或出错）几面下注，有几项选择可选取
data.enText: to reduce the risk of losing or making a mistake by supporting more than one side in a competition, an argument, etc., or by having several choices available to you

example: he did it on a bet

tr: the money risked on a gamble

example: you can count on me to help you any time
Look to your friends for support
Depend on your family in times of crisis

tr: maintain with or as if with a bet
example: I bet she will be there!

tr: stake on the outcome of an issue
example: I bet $100 on that new horse
She played all her money on the dark horse

value.boxr_value: The form bet is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle. bet 的过去式和过去分词与原形相同。

value.def: If you bet on the result of a horse race, football game, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.

example.ex: Jockeys are forbidden to bet on the outcome of races...
example.tran: 职业赛马骑师禁止对赛马结果下注。

example.ex: I bet £10 on a horse called Premonition...
example.tran: 我在一匹名叫“预兆”的赛马上下了10英镑的赌注。

example.ex: He bet them 500 pounds they would lose.
example.tran: 他和他们打赌500英镑说他们会输。

example.ex: Do you always have a bet on the Grand National?
example.tran: 你总是对全国赛马大会下点注吗？

example.ex: ...his thousand-pound fine for illegal betting.
example.tran: 他因非法赌博而被罚款1,000英镑。

example.ex: ...betting shops.
example.tran: 彩票销售点

value.def: A bet is a sum of money which you give to someone when you bet.

example.ex: You can put a bet on almost anything these days.
example.tran: 如今几乎可以对任何东西下赌注。

value.def: If someone is betting that something will happen, they are hoping or expecting that it will happen.

example.ex: The party is betting that the presidential race will turn into a battle for younger voters...
example.tran: 该党期待这次总统竞选变成一场争取年轻一代选民的斗争。

example.ex: People were betting on a further easing of credit conditions.
example.tran: 人们期待着贷款条件进一步放宽。

value.def: You use expressions such as 'I bet', 'I'll bet', and 'you can bet' to indicate that you are sure something is true.

example.ex: I bet you were good at games when you were at school...
example.tran: 我敢说你上学时体育很棒。

example.ex: I bet you anything you like he's a pimp...
example.tran: 我敢打包票，他是个皮条客。

example.ex: I'll bet they'll taste out of this world...
example.tran: 我敢说此味只应天上有。

example.ex: You can bet she will be there.
example.tran: 你大可放心，她一定会去那里的。

value.def: If you tell someone that something is a good bet, you are suggesting that it is the thing or course of action that they should choose.

example.ex: Textiles are a good bet for a country bent on industrialisation...
example.tran: 纺织业对于致力于工业化的国家来说是个比较稳妥的产业。

example.ex: Your best bet is to choose a guest house.
example.tran: 你最好选择一个小旅馆。

value.tran: 十拿九稳的事；有望成功的行动；合适之选

value.def: If you say that it is a good bet or a safe bet that something is true or will happen, you are saying that it is extremely likely to be true or to happen.

example.ex: It is a safe bet that the current owners will not sell.
example.tran: 十有八九现在的业主不会出售。

value.tran: 极有可能属实（或发生）的事

value.def: If you hedge your bets, you follow two courses of action to avoid making a decision between two things because you cannot decide which one is right.

example.ex: NASA is hedging its bets and adopting both strategies.
example.tran: 美国航空航天局做了两手准备，两套策略双管齐下。

value.def: You use I bet or I'll bet in reply to a statement to show that you agree with it or that you expected it to be true, usually when you are annoyed or amused by it.

example.ex: 'I'd like to ask you something,' I said. — 'I bet you would,' she grinned.
example.tran: “我想问你点事，”我说。——“我就知道你要问，”她笑道。

value.tran: （通常感到恼火或好笑时表示同意或认为属实）那是，说的是，一点没错

value.def: You can use my bet is or it's my bet to give your personal opinion about something, when you are fairly sure that you are right.

example.ex: My bet is that next year will be different...
example.tran: 我敢说明年不会这样。

example.ex: It's my bet that he's the guy behind this killing.
example.tran: 我认为他就是这起凶杀案的幕后主使。

value.def: If you say don't bet on something or I wouldn't bet on something, you mean that you do not think that something is true or will happen.

example.ex: 'We'll never get a table in there' — 'Don't bet on it.'
example.tran: “我们在那儿是订不上座了。”——“那可不一定。”

value.tran: 不要认为；别指望；不一定

value.def: If you reply 'Do you want to bet?' or 'Want a bet?' to someone, you mean you are certain that what they have said is wrong.

example.ex: 'Money can't buy happiness.' — 'Want to bet?'
example.tran: “金钱买不到幸福。”——“敢打赌吗？”

value.tran: （表示确信对方说的不对）敢打赌吗？

value.def: You use 'You bet' or 'you bet your life' to say yes in an emphatic way or to emphasize a reply or statement.

example.ex: 'It's settled, then?' — 'You bet.'...
example.tran: “那么，就这么定了？”——“定了。”

example.ex: 'Are you afraid of snakes?' — 'You bet your life I'm afraid of snakes.'
example.tran: “你怕蛇吗？”——“这还用问，我当然怕啦。”

trans: 迎妻接福；最佳选择；最好的办法；最好的措施
黑人娱乐电视颁奖礼；黑人娱乐电视奖；美国黑人娱乐电视奖；黑人娱乐电视大奖；颁奖盛典
被打破了；一切重来；协议取消
